item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

Heyyy…

In my Java Application I have a PaintBuffer class with a pixel buffer and a method to draw a pixel (in replacement of Java’s Graphics2D class):

private int[] pixels;

public void drawPixel(int x, int y) {
	if(x >= this.width || x < 0) {
		return;
	}
	if(y >= this.height || y < 0) {
		return;
	}
	this.pixels[(y * this.width) + x] = this.color;
}

I want to be able to draw visual text to my pixel array, however I am just dumbfounded on how to do it.

EDIT: Before anyone asks, I am not using Java’s Graphics2D class because it can get VERY slow VERY easily, and my application would cripple it.
